sentence: after rebuilding capital and liquidity in the early 1990s, followed by several years of post-world war ii record profits and very strong loan growth, our banks now have prudent capital and reserve positions.
the rapid increase in loans, though typical of a normal expansion of the economy, was unusual in that it was associated with more than a decade of uninterrupted economic growth.

even if correctly diagnosed, making that supervisory case to bank management can be difficult because, regrettably, incentives for loan officers and managers traditionally have rewarded loan growth, market share, and the profits that derive from booking interest income with, in retrospect, inadequate provisions for possible default.
and there was a further induced tightening of standards last year in response to early indications of deteriorating loan quality, months before aggregate growth slowed.
